lines.text:
[unzipping Jimmy's pants]
Jimmy, Jimmy can I see it?
Won't something happen?
Not if I don't want it to.
It looks funny.
Do you wanna hurt it's feelings?
I just don't feel like Jack the Ripper today!
Lisa, Aren't you even gonna kiss me goodbye?
Where would you sleep?
In bed, of course.
Whose bed?
We'll talk about that when we get there.
I'm going to rape her on the way out.

Al? Al Reardon? My father. My moral, upright, coffee sluping, status seeking, putting in overtime, hard day at the office, early rising, early bedding, make your own way in life father, had been screwing Joyce Fickett! that balding man with responsibilities was an extramarital joy-boy! no wonder i was having so much trouble! It was hereditary!

The damn thing just had to fizzle out at the most important moment of my life. Six months of patience and top level planning and believing and coaxing and wooing and now this! This power failure! This black out! and for what? For helping out that poor, frustrated woman? Was there no justice?
Do you want to give up? Is that what you're trying to tell me?
That's right...
Fine. Go to Harvard a virgin! But what are you gonna do when they ask you how many times you've scored? Those ivy league schools send out questionaires on that kinda stuff you know.
I'll lie.
Jesus, Fred; do you always have to drive nine miles an hour?
Hey, i don't need to drive fast to get my kicks.
How do you get your kicks?
He reads.
I happen to know there are only four out of our entire senior class.
Four what?
Girls! Who have not been de-flowered.
Yeah, right.
Ask me one?
Denise Hunter.
I know the boy who did it. It happen last summer at a splash party at the Bentwrights.
Lisa's house?
This was before you knew her. Anyway, Denise walked into one of the rooms and... whammo! The petals fell. Over the year I have counted enough fallen petals to cover the Rose Bowl.
